text: what if I told you that there's a
gambling city in Asia that makes five
times the annual revenue as Las Vegas
it's pretty insane to think about but
it's a real place and it's called Macau
it's my third time here since 2014 and
I'm just as amazed with each visit
before we learn about the bizarre
gambling scene you cannot come to Macau
without understanding its most
astonishing fact it was both the first
and last European colony in Asia the
Portuguese arrived on fishing boats in
the mid 16th century and they left four
hundred years later in 1999 until today
Macau feels very European with
cobblestone streets colorful buildings
delicious egg tarts an old church ruins
even the street signs are still in
Portuguese but the irony is that the
population is overwhelmingly Chinese
just like nearby Hong Kong which is only
40 miles away Macau acts as an
independent country but it's technically
owned by China
out of Macau's 30 million visitors a
year a whopping 90% of them come from
the mainland
most people come as a day trip to gamble
which is pretty much what my family and
I are doing today so that is the grand
lisboa the tallest building here in
Macau we're gonna head in there and
gamble right now
Macao is centered around gambling and
it's home to eight of the ten largest
casinos in the world do you like to
gamble
it has replicas of casinos in Vegas like
the Wynn MGM Grand and Venetian at a
half a million square feet
but unlike Vegas there isn't much
entertainment or nightlife here there
are no signs for Cirque du Soleil shows
or DJs playing at nightclubs Macau is
more of just gambling which the Chinese
love to do more than any other group of
people Macau is absolutely worth a day
trip from Hong Kong if you want to see
smell taste and feel something new and
hopefully you'll leave richer than you
came
I'm drew Binh ski and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world it's electric it's sexy
it's tasty it's confusing but above all
it's futuristic the Japanese are
innovators they somehow
